statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: LAS VEGAS HOLIDAY INVITATIONAL AT VALLEY HS IN LAS VEGAS NV

article.headline: Detroit 56, Shawnee State 51
article.story: LAS VEGAS (AP) -- Jon Goode scored a team-high 16 points to lead Detroit to a 56-51 win over Shawnee State on Friday in the third round of the Las Vegas Holiday Invitational. Goode went 5-of-6 from the free-throw line in the final 44 seconds to hold off a late Shawnee State rally. He also was 3-of-4 from 3-point range for the game. Also for Detroit (2-2), Zach Everingham added 12 points, on 4-of-8 shooting from 3-point range. The Titans, who are 1-2 in the Invitational, now play either Buffalo or Jackson State on Saturday in the fifth-place game of the championship round. Shawnee State (3-5) will play either Buffalo or Jackson State, also on Saturday, in the seventh-place game. Terrence Davison had a game-high 20 points. Davison kept the Bears close in the final seconds, hitting two 3-pointers to cut the lead to 55-51 with 17 seconds left. The Titans had built their biggest lead at 48-34 with 7:08 left in the game. Chuck Bailey had 8 points, 6 rebounds and 4 blocks for the winners. For the Bears, now 0-3 in the Invitational, Billy Younger had 9 points and 6 rebounds.
